glsa.title: libjpeg-turbo: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in libjpeg-turbo could result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

background.p: libjpeg-turbo accelerates JPEG compression and decompression.

description.p: A vulnerability in the get_sos() function in jdmarker.c could cause a heap-based buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JPEG file in an application linked against libjpeg-turbo, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application, or Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libjpeg-turbo users should upgrade to the latest version:
Packages which depend on this library may need to be recompiled. Tools such as revdep-rebuild may assist in identifying some of these packages.
